Explain a 5/1 ARM vs a 30-year fixed.

Red & Ko Bank explains that a 5/1 ARM has a fixed rate for five years and then adjusts annually, while a 30-year fixed keeps the same rate and principal and interest payment for the full term. ARMs can rise or fall based on index, margins, and caps.
